meanings.definition: The central vein or rib of a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The midrib of the leaf helps transport nutrients throughout the plant.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to tear the midrib when handling delicate leaves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the midrib as a tightrope to cross from one branch to another.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the midrib that held her family together during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The midrib stood out boldly against the bright green of the leaf.

meanings.definition: A ridge or raised line down the center of a fabric or material.
meanings.sent1: The midrib on the fabric added a decorative touch to the design.
meanings.sent2: She carefully sewed along the midrib to create a neat finish on the garment.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the midrib on the rug was a perfect scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The midrib of the carpet resembled a winding river flowing through the room.
meanings.sent5: The midrib on the tablecloth gave it a unique texture under her fingertips.
